last_episode_to_air.name: The Ring and I
last_episode_to_air.overview: When Larry discovers that Henry is hanging onto an engagement ring that he had planned to give Heather, he tries to get Henry to sell the ring and buy a wine refrigerator.

name: Happy Hour
overview:
Happy Hour is a sitcom that debuted on Fox in the United States and on CTV in Canada on September 7, 2006. The show starred John Sloan as Henry Beckman, a young man rebuilding his life after losing his girlfriend, his job, and his apartment. The series was produced by married duo Jackie and Jeff Filgo of That '70s Show.

Fox put the show on hiatus in September 2006, and officially canceled it the following May. Thirteen episodes of Happy Hour were made, of which four have aired and nine remain unaired.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: Henry Beckman has a girlfriend who convinces him to move to Chicago to work for her uncle. But his life is sent into a loop when she dumps him, which causes him to lose his job and to be thrown into an apartment with Larry, a man who has his own surreal opinions on life and women. Larry sets up Henry with a new job and life begins anew.  Of course, one of the house rules is that every day at four is Happy Hour.

episodes.name: The Mix CD
episodes.overview: Henry finds a mix CD of love songs and gets details about Larry's one true love, Molly. Amanda is concerned when a doctor in her gynecologist's office cancels a date with her.

episodes.name: Larry's Birthday
episodes.overview: It's Larry's birthday and his friends  all forgot about it.. all except Henry who got him a lame camping trip as a present.

episodes.name: The Ring and I
episodes.overview: When Larry discovers that Henry is hanging onto an engagement ring that he had planned to give Heather, he tries to get Henry to sell the ring and buy a wine refrigerator.

episodes.name: Crazy Girls
episodes.overview: When Henry dates a girl named Shauna, Larry warns him to stay away from her.  After Henry ignores the warnings he returns to Larry to help him get out of the relationship.

episodes.name: Thanksgiving
episodes.overview: Tina is planning a Thansgiving dinner, and her mother and sister are is planning to visit.  Unfortunately Brad makes too good of an impression on his mother-in-law as she puts the moves on him.

episodes.name: Boo! This Party Sucks
episodes.overview: Larry and Tina host separate Halloween parties and Brad begs everyone to attend Tina’s dreary party. Amanda and Heather wear identical sexy costumes to Larry’s party.

episodes.name: The Election
episodes.overview: With Tina and Brad’s rule on the tenants’ association coming to an end, Larry and Henry decide to run against them. Amanda gets bored with her doting husband.

episodes.name: The Family Affair
episodes.overview: Henry's parents are coming for a visit and he fears they'll be disappointed in him. Larry and Amanda have prejudices against them. Tina gets a job but she doesn't like Brad's excitement over it. Everyone may have to rethink their opinions.

episodes.name: 11:30 Snuggles
episodes.overview: Larry and Brad almost get into a fight in a bar, and Henry calls the police to save them, forgetting that all three are impersonating police officers to impress women.

episodes.name: New Year's Eve
episodes.overview: Everyone likes Amanda’s current boyfriend except for Larry, who gets a ‘bad vibe’ from him. Although Larry always protects Amanda, he goes too far this time and hurts her feelings.

episodes.name: A Dead Man's Ham
episodes.overview: It’s Christmas and Larry’s friends leave to be with their families, however they then decide to stay with him because all flights out of Chicago have been cancelled. However, at the apartment, the only food available is a mail-order ham that arrived for a neighbour who has died

episodes.name: The T-Shirt
episodes.overview: Larry’s T-Shirt business soars in popularity after George Clooney is seen wearing one of his shirts, however the reverse happens with Kevin Federline. Heather then saves the business by changing the company slogan.
